Title: Service Reliability Analyst II (ITIL)
RoleDescription:
The Process & Analytics team focuses on using operational data to understand the player experience and provide that visibility to Riot. This team strives to collect, audit and use data to improve our games operational health; empowering game leadership to make data informed decisions to improve stability.  
As a Service Reliability Analyst II, you will work with teams across Riot to build and execute effective ITIL processes, measurements of service health, and a highly contextual picture of the player experience. Your tenacity and drive for continuous improvement will help you uncover problematic trends and push for their resolution, improving the quality of the player experience. You will be a craft master in operational process and telling compelling visual stories with data. Live Ops can look to you to improve ITIL process, answer tough operational questions through data, and uncover previously unknown anti-patterns harming the player experience. 
Responsibilities:

Lead and facilitate weekly technical discussions on service reliability with key product teams, ensuring alignment on operational goals and performance metrics.
Conduct thorough audits of incident data in collaboration with service owners to validate accuracy and ensure comprehensive reporting and analysis.
Collect, synthesize, and report on system health metrics for Riot's diverse infrastructure, utilizing advanced data collection methods and monitoring tools.
Perform in-depth analysis of operational data trends to identify and address systemic issues and optimize service performance.
Participate in on-call rotations to provide critical support and ensure rapid response to incidents, minimizing downtime and service disruptions.
Assist in tracking and coordinating corrective actions for root cause analysis, ensuring thorough resolution of underlying issues and continuous improvement of operational processes.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that provide insights into key operational performance metrics, assisting leaders with making data-driven decisions.

Required Qualifications: 

2-4 years of hands-on experience in IT service management, data analysis, or technical operations, with a focus on maintaining and optimizing IT infrastructure.
Strong proficiency in incident, problem, change, and release management, with the ability to design and implement process flows using industry-standard methodologies.
Solid understanding of software development life cycles (SDLC) and how various components interact within larger ecosystems, ensuring seamless operation and scalability.  
Clear awareness of system and service ownership within a multi-team environment, including the effective use of APIs/SDKs and adherence to SLAs.
Deep enthusiasm for operations and technology, with a proactive approach to continuous improvement in system reliability and performance.
ITIL-based Ticketing Systems: In-depth experience with ServiceNow, JIRA, or similar platforms for tracking and managing IT service processes.
Experience with the following tools and technologies:



Data Visualization Tools: Advanced skills in Tableau, DataWrapper, and Excel for creating actionable insights from complex datasets.
Query Languages: Proficient in JQL, SQL, and XQuery for querying and manipulating data across various platforms.
Monitoring Solutions: Expertise in setting up and managing monitoring frameworks using tools like DataDog and NewRelic to ensure system health and performance.
Event Management Tools: Skilled in Event Correlation to improve Incident Response with tools such as Datadog, Big Panda or PagerDuty





Desired Qualifications:

2+ years of specialized experience in Service Reliability Engineering (SRE) or equivalent roles such as Technical Release Manager, Process Owner, Live Operations Engineer, or Network Administrator.
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, IT Systems, Information Technology, or a closely related field, or equivalent professional experience.
Advanced data analysis and data insights proficiency, with the ability to derive actionable intelligence from large datasets.
Relevant certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, CompTIA Linux+, or CompTIA Network+, or equivalent credentials, are highly valued.
Demonstrated expertise in deploying and managing monitoring solutions such as DataDog and NewRelic to ensure system health and performance within complex environments

Title: Senior Line Producer - Esports Content Services
RoleDescription:
In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends and has since gone on to become the most played PC game in the world and a key driver of the dramatic growth of Esports. At the core is the Pubsports team, the group responsible for operating the major League of Legends, Valorant and other competitive international tournaments, defining global policies for the sport, driving global narratives, and providing services to our 14 different regional professional leagues across multiple products. Our vision is to spark mind-blowing cultural moments around our Games, uniting players through passion, competition, and creativity.  Thats where you come in.
Line Producers at Riot are responsible for the financial, administrative and operational management of global events, regional arenas and studios, and remote broadcast facilities ensuring alignment between budget, production execution, and strategic goals. As a Senior Line Producer within Esports Content Services, you will oversee budgeting, financial tracking, and vendor management for our live events and studio operations while also driving improvements in vendor production workflows and documentation.
Reporting to the Director of Production Finance, Esports Content Services, you will be an integral part of our remote broadcast facilities management team. You will partner with multiple stakeholders, including our global events, regional arenas and studios to allocate resources effectively, make financially informed decisions, and optimize production workflows to enhance operational efficiency and standardization across the remote broadcast centers.
Responsibilities

Lead forecasting, vendor management, and cost negotiations for world-wide production finance operations, ensuring efficient resource allocation and execution.
Develop and implement Production Finance department procedures, systems and  workflows improvements between regional and global operations. 
Manage financial operations of productions, managing budgets, forecasting, cost tracking, and reporting, while ensuring compliance and providing financial insights to creative and production teams across regional offices.
Establish, maintain, and optimize vendor Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), workflows, and production documentation to drive efficiency and standardization across remote broadcast centers, global events, regional arenas and studios.
Oversee vendor staffing plans, contingent workforce allocation, and production scheduling to align with Riots operational needs and production cycles.
Ensure smooth day-to-day finance business operations, implementing escalation procedures to swiftly identify and resolve issues.
Deliver financial and operational reports to leadership, analyzing production changes and their impact on contract obligations and cost forecasts.
Collaborate with stakeholders, production partners, and vendor leads to ensure seamless execution of remote broadcast center, global events, regional arenas and studio operations.
Contribution to the development of operational plans and production schedules, ensuring resources, workflows, and deliverables align with Riot Games service requirements.
Participate in strategic planning and forecasting rituals, contributing insights to improve production efficiency and financial sustainability through contingent workforce planning.
Actualize operational budgets while working with production accounting, and other company financial departments collaborating with all teams within Riot to ensure accuracy and tracking of expenses.
Facilitate the creation and submission of POs, SOWs, work orders and processing vendors through our production finance platform, global procurement, legal and vendor management systems for our remote broadcast facilities, global events, regional arenas and studios.
Partner with both global and regional corporate finance teams, accounts payable, procurement, purchasing, tax and legal to set up processes and workflows for contracting and paying vendors both globally and locally around the globe.
Partner with vendors and production partners to understand their finance and accounting workflows to determine the best practices to integrate them into our model for successful cost management. 
Collaborate with Riots accounts payable to make sure contractors and vendors are paid on time and there is Riot policy adherence.

Required Qualifications

8+ years of experience in production and/or live events.
6+ years of experience as a Line Producer or equivalent senior production role.
Hands-on experience as a Line Producer or Senior Production Manager, with expertise in project management and production operations for live events and live broadcast entertainment.
Strong financial management skills in a production environment.
Proven ability to develop and manage vendor partnerships, production documentation, and training programs.
Experience in multiple entertainment budget tracking systems, including Movie Magic, Showbiz, Xytech Media Pulse, Microsoft Excel, and Google Sheets.
Demonstrated ability to drive process improvements and operational efficiencies in live event production environments.

Desired Qualifications

10+ years of experience in production.
8+ years of experience in line producing.
Background in production accounting or experience as a production accountant.
Experience with remote broadcast centers and large-scale Esports production environments.
Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills to optimize production execution and cost management.

This role is a key position within our Esports Content Services team, providing the opportunity to shape the future of Riot Games global production capabilities while ensuring financial sustainability and operational excellence.

Title: Principal Researcher - RDS Central User Research Team
RoleDescription:
The Insights discipline empowers Rioters to make more informed, data-driven decisions. Were an interdisciplinary team of user researchers, scientists, advisors, and strategists from a wide range of backgrounds, united by a love of games, a passion for science, and a commitment to helping others succeed. By illuminating the globally diverse experiences, behaviors, and needs of players, we help Riot stay true to its player-focused mission.
As a Principal User Researcher on the Central User Research (CUR) team, youll not only shape Riots understanding of players, but also guide strategic and operational decisions across all R&D games at Riot. Your work will drive strategic decisions about the audiences we serve, the opportunities we pursue, and how our games evolve to deliver richer, more player-driven experiences. Youll design and conduct a wide range of studiessuch as in-lab playtests, qualitative interviews, audience research, and global market surveysin close collaboration with game teams and other insights partners. In addition, youll own and advance CURs research craft standards, ensuring that our practices are rigorous, impactful, and player-centered. Youll report to the CUR Sr. Manager and operate as a key strategic partner across Riots R&D efforts.
Responsibilities:

Design and execute end-to-end studies using a wide range of qualitative and quantitative methods to uncover player motivations, pain points, and emerging opportunity areas.
Lead complex, high-impact research workstreams across Riot R&Devolving milestone testing practices, establishing playtesting benchmarks, informing milestone & development decisions, and solving sophisticated research challenges.
Generate strategic insights that challenge assumptions and directly influence product and game direction across Riot.
Communicate research findings through compelling narratives that align stakeholders and drive executive decision-making.
Champion the player perspective by delivering evidence-based guidance on player needs, motivations, and behaviors.
Collaborate closely with game teams and insights partners to develop and socialize research-driven frameworks that shape both individual game strategy and broader portfolio direction.
Advance strategic thinking and research framework development across R&D to support long-term innovation and player-focused development.
Own research craft standards for the Central User Research (CUR) teammentoring researchers and leading infrastructure improvements to raise the bar across CUR and Riot.

Required Qualifications:

8+ years of relevant research experience (advanced degrees may substitute for up to 2 years).
4+ years of research experience specifically within the games industry.
Demonstrated ability to conduct research that informs game product and portfolio strategy.
Experienced in both qualitative and quantitative research methodsincluding in-depth-interviews, focus groups, playtests, diary studies, and surveyswith deep specialization in at least one.
Proficient in core statistical methodsincluding regression, correlation, and factor analysisand experienced with a statistical package such as Q, R, or SPSS.
Strong understanding of game design, direction, and game product strategy.
3+ years of experience partnering directly with senior executives or high-level stakeholders.
Skilled at synthesizing research findings into clear, actionable insights for product leadership.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills; able to influence across all levels of an organization.
Proven ability to independently lead complex, multi-stakeholder projects and cross-functional workstreams in collaboration with diverse partners.
Experience managing external vendors in driving research/insights projects.
Demonstrated experience mentoring researchers, teaching research best practices, or developing systems and processes that advance the craft and impact of research within an organization.

Desired Qualifications:

Masters degree or higher in a human-focused discipline such as Psychology, Anthropology, or Human-Computer Interaction.
Experience in creating and validating benchmark metrics to support longitudinal tracking and strategic decision-making.
Experience supporting game teams across the pre-launch lifecycle (incubation, prototype, preproduction, production).
Experience partnering with Data Scientists & Analytics to integrate qualitative and quantitative insights.
Proficiency with Tableau and SQL for data visualization and exploration.
Advanced proficiency with Excel or Sheets for analysis and reporting.

Title: Counsel, Production

The Riot Legal team has the responsibility to constantly provide the highest quality legal services that fully align with Riots company mission of putting players first. Figuring out whats best for the company always begins with thinking about whats best for players. Every policy or contract that we draft; every lawsuit that we file or defend against; every letter we send; and all the legal advice that we give to our business partners, must always be done with our players interests in mind.
Riot is now creating more content than ever before. In recent years we transformed from a one-game company to a company with multiple games and entertainment properties. We are looking for a Production Counsel who thrives in a dynamic, collaborative environment. Youll help bring Riots stories and experiences to life by providing expert legal support across content and event production. This role reports to the Director, Legal Counsel and will support teams across Riots portfolio on a wide range of production related legal matters, including animation and live action projects, online and live esports events, music initiatives, product launches and marketing events, with the opportunity to grow and evolve depending on your interests and the businesss needs. Collaborate with the global Legal team to protect the interests of Riot and its players.

Title: Principal Insights Researcher - VALORANT
RoleDescription:
The Insights discipline helps empower Rioters' decision-making to be more data-informed. We're an interdisciplinary group of scientists, consultants, and strategists from all sorts of backgrounds who join together to represent and advocate for gamers around the world. We believe that illuminating the globally diverse experiences, behaviors, and needs of gamers is critical to Riot living up to our player-focused mission. We're a group united by our love of games, science, and helping others succeed.
As a Principal Researcher, youll join the Insights discipline  the group of researchers, analysts, data scientists, and strategists responsible for solving problems and executing analyses that enable Rioters to make difficult decisions with confidence. Youll be part of an interdisciplinary team and work closely with Rioters from other disciplines (designers, artists, producers, etc.) to conduct studies and analyses that will inform the features, systems, and experiences of our products. Your applied or experimental research background coupled with your deep understanding of data will ensure that youre an effective advocate for players and can provide strategic guidance about their wants, needs, and behaviors.
As a Principal Researcher reporting to the Senior Manager, Insights on VALORANT, you will be working with product leadership and the broader insights team to tackle complex problem spaces facing the game. On VALORANT, youll be tasked with identifying strategic opportunities and leveraging your expertise in Research to help guide and inform decision making across VALORANT. This role will also be integral in setting the bar for Research within VALORANT and Riot overall as well as mentoring and leveling up junior Researchers on the team.
Responsibilities:

Own highly complex insights workstreams to help illuminate key opportunity areas for VALORANT
Lead multi-modal projects across analytics and research to help answer critical product questions
Construct, organize, and execute studies and surveys across a variety of methods designed to answer business and product strategy questions
Engage with senior leadership to highlight player needs and drive product change through your work
Partner with product leaders to prioritize their efforts - accounting for delivery timelines, revenue impacts, and opportunity costs
Be the research craft expert on VALORANT to help educate and mentor other researchers on the team
Communicate strategic recommendations and product outcomes to business leaders and decision makers
Work collaboratively with a cross functional team of designers, product managers, and engineers

Provide strategic insights to test teams assumptions and inform their actions
Share your results with other Rioters in clear, illustrative presentations

Bachelor's degree in Psychology, Anthropology, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related discipline plus at least 8 years of relevant research experience (an advanced degree can account for 1 to 2 years of experience depending on Masters or PhD) 
Broad experience in quantitative and qualitative research methods including conducting interviews, focus groups, and online community studies, as well as performing survey research with deep expertise in at least one of these areas
3+ years doing research specifically in the games industry 
Experience conducting research to answer product or portfolio strategy questions
Experience synthesizing & socializing research results and distilling results into impactful recommendations for product leadership
Trusted to operate independently regardless of structure and to have owned larger problems/projects/workstreams.

Experience leading complex efforts with multiple collaborators

As the Sr. Manager, Publishing Product Management - 2XKO in APAC, you will be responsible for leading the publishing efforts and community engagement in locally served countries and languages within your subregion. Reporting to the GM of APAC, you will drive subregional strategies aligned with the broader regional and global objectives. Your deep understanding of market trends and cultural nuances will be critical as you work to deliver exceptional value to players while ensuring optimal operational efficiency and performance.
You will play a key role in advocating for your subregions needs in global decision-making processes and ensuring that subregional product ecosystems and community involvement thrive. In this role, youll also oversee budgeting and resource allocation to support the successful execution of regional goals.
Key Responsibilities

Develop and execute subregional strategies aligned with regional and global priorities, focusing on product ecosystems, community engagement, and market trends
Represent the region in ecosystem-level conversations, participating in key workstreams to ensure regional needs are addressed. 
Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, ensuring regional needs are prioritized in global decision-making
Identify risks in regional projects and provide cultural and market expertise to ensure alignment with global strategies.
Build and manage a high performing, regionally diverse team. Recruit and mentor team members and foster a diverse and growth-oriented team environment.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in marketing, business administration, or comparable work experience.
8+ years of in depth experience in game publishing or a similar field, with a focus on leading regional or subregional teams to deliver on product, marketing, and ecosystem goals.
5+ years of experience in management roles within gaming, sports, or media industries.
Significant experience in launching or scaling game products or services across different regions or markets.
Extensive experience working in a global video game or entertainment company, with a strong understanding of the fighting game genre player base and community.
Deep understanding of cultural nuances and regional market trends, with the ability to advocate for local needs in global decision-making.
Proven ability to manage multiple complex projects or initiatives simultaneously, ensuring alignment with global goals, timelines, and budget constraints.
Proven success working in a matrixed environment, managing cross-functional teams across various geographies.
Proven experience in managing regional budgets, including allocating resources effectively and tracking financial performance.

Desired Qualifications

Advanced degree (MBA or equivalent) in business, marketing, or a related field.
Multilingual capabilities relevant to the subregions, enhancing communication with local stakeholders and partners.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable strategies for publishing and community engagement.
Deep expertise in the fighting game genre, including its market dynamics, competitive scene, player communities, and cultural impact.

Title: Insight Analyst III, Esports Insights
RoleDescription:
The Esports team is focused on delivering amazing fan experiences through our global events and regional competitions. Our professional and semi-professional competitive tiers in League of Legends, VALORANT and other Esports involve thousands of players and hundreds of organizations competing every week. 
The Insights discipline helps empower Rioters' decision-making to be more data-informed, and in this role, you will join the Esports Insights team and work alongside the product team to ensure that product strategies and decisions are grounded in data, leading to positive outcomes for both fans and Riot. You will lead analytics projects for esports that drive understanding of our global esports audience and players,  uncover product opportunities for sports across our portfolio. 
As an Insights Analyst III, you will use strategic thinking, quantitative analysis, and structured problem solving to inform product decisions and ultimately improve business and player outcomes for our games and sports. You will report directly to the Manager of Esports Insights.

Partner with product managers to identify high-impact strategic bets and growth opportunities for sports within global esports.
Define and implement KPIs for international leagues, enabling regional leads to optimize operations through data-driven insights.
Break down complex challenges into structured, data-informed frameworks that empower stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Develop new metrics and analytical models to identify global gaming audiences and Riot Games esports audience, informing product and portfolio strategy.
Build dashboards, data pipelines, and experiments to analyze key performance drivers, player behaviors, and overall league performance.
Design and implement A/B tests and causal inference methodologies to evaluate product efficacy, driving meaningful outcomes for players and fans.
Work closely with Insights and product teams at Riots Los Angeles headquarters to align on strategic priorities and enhance data capabilities.

5+ years professional experience in analytics, data science, product management, business strategy, or related field

Strong stakeholder management and communications skills

Proficiency in Tableau
Experience in data pipeline tools such as dbt
Experience working in gaming, media or related industry
Expertise working with senior executive stakeholders or product team counterparts

Title: Esports Project Manager (12 Month Contract)

The selected candidate will be responsible for executing each step of a project, coordinating the flow between Partner, Agencies and Riot's internal teams in Portuguese and/or English languages. Additionally, this professional will be the main point of contact for sponsors in the day-to-day operation, professionally representing the department and ensuring a strong and positive relationship with partners. Title: Principal Analytics Engineer - Product Insights
RoleDescription:
At Riot, Data Engineers play a critical role in transforming data into actionable insights that drive decisions across the company. Our engineers are deeply player-focused and collaborate across diverse teams to enhance the experiences of millions of players worldwide.
As a Principal Data Engineer within the Product Insights team, you will be a key technical leader responsible for designing and optimizing scalable data infrastructure that empowers Insights teams. You will develop and maintain high-performance ETL pipelines; architect efficient, reliable, and usable data models; and ensure data governance, security, and compliance.This role demands deep technical expertise, the ability to work on complex data engineering challenges, and cross-functional collaboration with engineering, analytics, and product teams. You will set best practices, drive automation, and enhance data reliability and performance while ensuring the organization has the right data infrastructure to support its business needs.

Design and optimize scalable ETL pipelines for structured and semi-structured data to support Insights use cases, including independently coding and providing optimizations where applicable.
Architect and implement robust, maintainable, and high-performance data solutions.
Ensure data quality, governance, and compliance with regulatory standards (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Mentor data engineers across all levels, setting best practices and fostering technical growth.
Automate workflows to reduce manual intervention and enhance data processing efficiency.
Optimize query performance and resolve pipeline bottlenecks to improve data accessibility.
Evaluate and adopt new tools, frameworks, and methodologies to advance data engineering capabilities.
Support cost optimization by ensuring scalable and efficient data solutions.
Be a leader within Riots Data Engineering discipline shaping infrastructure, craft standards, tooling, and organizational best practices

Bachelor's or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field.
8+ years experience in data engineering or a related field.
Hands-on expertise in big-data technologies, including Python, GoLang, Spark, Scala, SQL, and tools like Airflow and DBT.
Proficiency in cloud infrastructure (AWS or GCP) and Databricks.
Expertise in designing efficient and scalable data models with large data sets across multiple teams and in collaboration with insights or data stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally with engineering, analytics, and product teams.
Experience mentoring and guiding other engineers.

Title: Senior Researcher, WR
RoleDescription:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played PC game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and its for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience. 
Were looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; youre passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, arent afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.
That's where you come in.
The Insights discipline helps empower Rioters' decision-making to be more data-informed. We're an interdisciplinary group of scientists, consultants, and strategists from all sorts of backgrounds who join together to represent and advocate for players around the world. We believe that illuminating the globally diverse experiences, behaviors, and needs of players is critical to Riot living up to our player-focused mission. We're a group united by our love of games, science, and helping others succeed.
As a Senior Researcher, WR, youll join the Insights discipline  the group of researchers, analysts, data scientists, and strategists responsible for solving problems and executing analyses that enable Rioters to make difficult decisions with confidence. Youll be part of an interdisciplinary team and work closely with Rioters from other disciplines (designers, artists, producers, etc.) to conduct studies and analyses that will inform the features, systems, and experiences of our products. Your applied or experimental research background coupled with your deep understanding of data will ensure that youre an effective advocate for players and can provide strategic guidance about their wants, needs, and behaviors.
As a Senior Researcher reporting to the Insights Lead on Wild Rift, you will be working across the Dev team, supporting the development of Live Features as well as incubation projects. Title: Insights Analyst III - VALORANT, Cross VALORANT Experience
RoleDescription:
The Insights discipline helps empower Rioters' decision-making to be more data-informed. We're an interdisciplinary group of scientists, consultants, and strategists from all sorts of backgrounds who join together to represent and advocate for players around the world. We believe that illuminating the globally diverse experiences, behaviors, and needs of players is critical to Riot living up to our player-focused mission. We're a group united by our love of games, science, and helping others succeed.
As an Insights Analyst III, youll join the Insights discipline  the group of researchers, analysts, data scientists, and strategists responsible for solving problems and executing analyses that enable Rioters to make difficult decisions with confidence. Youll be part of an interdisciplinary team and work closely with Rioters from other disciplines (designers, artists, producers, etc.) to conduct studies and analyses thatll inform the features, systems, and experiences of our products. Your background in data analysis and strategic decision-making will ensure that youre an effective advocate for players and can provide strategic mentorship about their wants, needs, and behaviors.
As an Insights Analyst III on VALORANT, you will work with the Cross-Valorant Experience (XVX) team, supporting the development of the holistic player journey in VALORANT, from the new player experience to long-term player needs. You will use data to answer questions such as:

How do we improve the new player experience?
How are players engaging with features in the game client?
How healthy is the state of Valorants technical performance?
And much more!

You will use your quantitative analysis -- including supporting generation and implementation of telemetry, developing quantitative models of product health, and generating foundational dashboards  to improve the player experience of VALORANT. You will also use your strategic thinking to help teams interpret complex trends, break down ambiguous problems, craft principles for success, and identify the right paths forwards. If you're looking to use your analytics toolkit and collaborate with designers and product owners to create industry-leading and player behavior systems, this is an excellent opportunity for you.
 
Responsibilities:

Partner with product teams to produce frameworks and insights that improve the existing competitive and player behavior systems in VALORANT
Work with leadership to prioritize development, taking into account delivery timelines, product impact, and opportunity cost.
Identify the most impactful product questions and partner with data and engineering to implement the telemetry necessary to answer those questions
Communicate strategic recommendations and product outcomes to business leaders and decision makers
Use your storytelling skills to share your results with other Rioters
Become the data expert for the broad collective Valorant player experience
Work collaboratively with a cross functional team of designers, product managers, and engineers

 
Required Qualifications:

6+ years of experience in business intelligence, economic analysis, or related fields
Proficiency in SQL, can maintain complex spreadsheets, and experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools
Deep love for the scientific method - developing and testing hypotheses, and reporting on outcomes are important functions
Experience breaking down complex problems and problem spaces using multiple business or product frameworks and creating solutions for our players and our business
Experience analyzing large datasets and communicating recommendations to leadership/partners

Advanced degrees in Economics, Behavioral Economics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Management Information Systems, a related discipline, or comparable work experiences
Can take broad questions and refine them into tightly-defined data requirements
